text: Anisophyllea disticha is a plant of tropical Asia in the family Anisophylleaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Latin meaning "2-ranked", referring to the leaf arrangement. ==Description== Anisophyllea disticha grows as a shrub or small tree up to tall with a stem diameter of up to . Its bark is smooth. The ellipsoid fruits ripen red and measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Anisophyllea disticha grows naturally in Sumatra, Peninsular Malaysia and Borneo. Its habitat is forests from sea-level to altitude. ==References== disticha Category:Flora of Sumatra Category:Flora of Peninsular Malaysia Category:Flora of Borneo Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Taxa named by Henri Ernest Baillon Category:Taxa named by William Jack (botanist)
title: Anisophyllea disticha
